intro: Serpocaulon triseriale, commonly known as the three-ranked serpocaulon, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves that are arranged in a unique three-ranked pattern, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of its family. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors or rocky crevices. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
